column4: can anyone help? I can't install samba through apt-get - the package is getting a 404 error
Err http://security.ubuntu.com gutsy-security/main samba 3.0.26a-1ubuntu2.1 403 Forbidden
do i have to compile the source myself?
ill try
you gan get it from mirrors.kernel.org, but you have to fix the dependency errors by hand
I can't find the samba package on that mirror site you gave me - what would it be under?
a sec
s/kernel.com/kernel.org/
thanks
same with security.ubuntu.com, that's mirrors.kernel.org as well
you have an ubuntu source listed somewhere ... and I think you should read what nsteeves just posted if you need samba functionality now
should i just wait till they fix it? then try it later?
I'd wait till it was fixed; you could also take erUSUL 's advice and comment out security for now
you need to do update (reload?) first
what? sorry im new to ubuntu :(
the reload button will update your sources, removing the security sources.
i have no idea what reload button your talking about
on synaptic, left button below the menu bar
mark all upgrades, then apply
i did that, still getting the same error
ill leave you alone - i can ask box1 if you want
then you haven't disabled the security source yet, settings->repositories, updates tab, uncheck important security updates
then reload, mark for upgrades, and apply
